kb_body.p: Chrome makes it very easy to import bookmarks and settings from other web browsers.
If you're just starting with Chrome, you'll see an Import bookmarks now link at the top. If not, click on the "wrench" button in the upper-right corner, then Bookmarks, Import Bookmarks and Settings.
Select the browser whose bookmarks you want to import. If there are any settings from that browser you do not want to import, uncheck the appropriate box. Then click Import and you're done.
By default, Chrome will put the imported bookmarks in a separate folder. You may want to click on Bookmarks, Bookmark manager and rearrange them for quicker access.
